children.value: Generally speaking, you have many ways to help develop
code, for example, find a bug, write it down and submit a PR (Pull Requests), or simply give a piece of advice on a feature.
, it is best to submit your first PR when you have any questions in the process. You can always consult any project member in the comment area by using "@" any project member.

If you want to learn how to run OpenSumi or debug an issue, you need to get the code locally, build it and run it.
In the first step, you need to fork a copy of the
repository, and then clone it locally:
Usually you need to synchronize the latest branch code in advance before modifying or submitting the code.
After handling the code conflicts, you can submit the code to your repository, and go to
to submit your PR at any time.
also contains a lot of GitHub Actions. If you don't want to execute these Actions, you can go to
After the initialization is complete, you can run the Web version directly by using the following command, and enable
at the same time. All modifications except the extension process can be seen in the Web in real time.

directory under the project as the workspace directory. You can also open OpenSumi by specifying the path with

You can test the code of a module (the following code test module is debug, that is, the debug directory in the packages directory) by using the following command.
You can also debug breakpoints on test files currently activated by the editor, using the
, you can directly retrieve the overall code specification. Meanwhile when the code is committed, corresponding code formatting checks will be triggered.
Each commit should be as small as possible, and you need to fill in your commit information in accordance with
For example, when you fix the variable acquisition problem of the debug module, the submission information can be as follows:
fix: fix variable acquisition under the debug panel
For PR content, just follow the PR and fill in the template.
If you want to debug the extension process under the OpenSumi framework, you can link your local extension process to the
directory in the form of soft link, for example:
You can quickly preview the effect by refreshing the page.
For common spelling issues, We recommend that you install
or an IDE built on OpenSumi, to avoid English spelling mistakes.
